x-redlock-auth.description: The x-redlock-auth value is a JSON Web Token (JWT).
x-redlock-auth.name: x-redlock-auth

redlockMapping.description: true = Prisma Cloud will provide field value for notification

typeaheadUri.description: URL used to query suggestions for field value

name.description: Name. Cannot include special characters ('<', '>', '!', '=', '\\n', '\\r'). Maximum length is 99.

info.description: Notification templates allow you to map the Prisma Cloud alert payload to the ServiceNow or Jira incident fields.
info.title: Prisma Cloud User Notification Templates API Overview

get.description: Returns a list of notification templates.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://api.prismacloud.io/notification/template?type=SOME_STRING_VALUE' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

post.description:
Adds a new notification template. The following is an example of the request body parameters to add an email notification template. ```json { "enabled": true, "templateConfig": { "basic_config": [ { "displayName": "Custom Note", "fieldName": "custom_note", "options": [], "type": "text", "value": "

This is a test

\n" } ], "dismissed": [], "open": [], "resolved": [] }, "integrationType": "email", "templateType": "ticketing", "name": "test_email_1" } ``` The following is an example of the request body parameters to add a ServiceNow notification template. ```json { "integrationId": "d7bcc9b1-4f9b-4ac2-819e-d83c204f3ba2", "integrationType": "service_now", "integrationName": "DND-EI-SNOW-ORLANDO-copy2", "customerId": 6, "name": "SNOW-ORALNDO-INC-copy2", "templateConfig": { "open": [ { "fieldName": "description", "displayName": "Description (open_description)", "type": "text", "options": [], "redlockMapping": true, "required": false, "value": "NS1.0\nAccountId <$AccountId>\nAccountName <$AccountName>\nAlertDismissalNote <$AlertDismissalNote>\nSeverity <$Severity>\nStatus <$Status>", "maxLength": 4000 }, { "fieldName": "state", "displayName": "State (open_state)", "type": "list", "options": [ { "name": "New", "key": "1" } ], "redlockMapping": false, "required": true, "value": "New", "maxLength": 40 } ], "resolved": [ { "fieldName": "state", "displayName": "State (resolved_state)", "type": "list", "options": [ { "name": "Closed", "key": "7" } ], "redlockMapping": false, "required": true, "value": "Closed", "maxLength": 40 }, { "fieldName": "description", "displayName": "Description (resolved_description)", "type": "text", "options": [], "redlockMapping": true, "required": false, "value": "NS1.0\nAccountId <$AccountId>\nAccountName <$AccountName>\nAlertDismissalNote <$AlertDismissalNote>\nSeverity <$Severity>\nStatus <$Status>", "maxLength": 4000 } ], "dismissed": [ { "fieldName": "description", "displayName": "Description (dismissed_description)", "type": "text", "options": [], "redlockMapping": true, "required": false, "value": "NS1.0\nAccountId <$AccountId>\nAccountName <$AccountName>\nAlertDismissalNote <$AlertDismissalNote>\nAlertId <$AlertId>\nSeverity <$Severity>\nStatus <$Status>", "maxLength": 4000 }, { "fieldName": "state", "displayName": "State (dismissed_state)", "type": "list", "options": [ { "name": "Closed", "key": "7" } ], "redlockMapping": false, "required": true, "value": "Closed", "maxLength": 40 } ], "basic_config": [ { "fieldName": "incidentType", "displayName": "Incident Type", "type": "list", "options": [ { "name": "Incident", "key": "incident" } ], "redlockMapping": false, "required": true, "value": "Incident" } ] }, "enabled": true, "status": "GREEN", "valid": true, "templateType": "ticketing" } ``` The following is an example of the request body parameters to add a Jira notification template. ```json { "integrationType": "jira", "templateType": "ticketing", "name": "jira-template-example", "integrationName":"qa-jira-D", "status": "RED", "valid": false, "customerId": 32, "integrationId": "017018f9-3d8b-4f9b-8534-a7043bea26ce", "enabled": true, "templateConfig": { "basic_config": [ { "fieldName": "issueType", "displayName": "Issue Type", "type": "list", "options": [ { "id": "10002", "name": "Task" } ], "redlockMapping": false, "required": true, "value": "Task" }, { "fieldName": "project", "displayName": "Project", "type": "list", "options": [ { "id": "JI", "name": "Jira-Integration", "key": "JI" } ], "redlockMapping": false, "required": false, "value": "RedLock-Jira-Integration" } ], "dismissed": [], "open": [ { "fieldName": "summary", "displayName": "Summary", "type": "text", "options": [], "redlockMapping": true, "required": true, "disabled": true, "value": "AccountId <$AccountId>\nAccountName <$AccountName>\nAlertDismissalNote <$Severity>\nStatus <$Status>\nUserAttributionData <$UserAttributionData>" }, { "fieldName": "description", "displayName": "Description", "type": "text", "options": [], "redlockMapping": true, "required": false, "disabled": false, "value": "AccountId <$AccountId>\nAccountName <$AccountName>\nAlertDismissalNote <$AlertDismissalNote>" }, { "fieldName": "priority", "displayName": "Priority", "type": "list", "options": [ { "id": "5", "name": "Low" } ], "redlockMapping": false, "required": false, "disabled": false, "value": "Low" } ] } } ````

import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/notification/template"

headers = {
    'content-type': "application/json; charset=UTF-8",
    'x-redlock-auth': "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"
    }

response = requests.request("POST", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/notification/template \
  --header 'content-type: application/json; charset=UTF-8' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

post.description:
Clones an existing notification template to create a new template.  

There is currently only one body parameter, as shown below.

Parameter | Type | Value | Required 
-------------| ---- | ----------- | ---
name | string | The name of the new notification template | Required

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/notification/template/clone/{id}"

headers = {
    'content-type': "application/json; charset=UTF-8",
    'x-redlock-auth': "REPLACE_KEY_VALUE"
    }

response = requests.request("POST", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request POST \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/notification/template/clone/{id} \
  --header 'content-type: application/json; charset=UTF-8' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

get.description:
Lists the fields available to include in a ServiceNow notification template.  

You can find the **integrationId** and **incidentType** in the [List Notification Template](/api/cloud/cspm/notification-templates#operation/get-notification-templates) 
response object. If you already know your **integrationId**, you can find the **incidentType** in the
[Get Notifcation Template](/api/cloud/cspm/notification-templates#operation/get-notification-template) response object.
In each response object, the **incidentType** is the value of **templateConfig>basicConfig>options>key**.

x-codeSamples.source:
import requests

url = "https://api.prismacloud.io/template/servicenow/{integrationId}/{incidentType}/fields"

headers = {'x-redlock-auth': 'REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'}

response = requests.request("GET", url, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

curl --request GET \
  --url https://api.prismacloud.io/template/servicenow/{integrationId}/{incidentType}/fields \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'

get.description:
Lists suggestions for the specified integration, service type, and field name. Accepts a query to narrow the list.  

You can find

An example curl request is:
```
curl --request \
--url 'https://api.prismacloud.io/template/servicenow/11111110-2222-3333-4444444/INCIDENT/fields/core_company/country/suggestions?query=japan'
--header 'x-redlock-auth: <JWT>' 
```

The URL in tne example above includes the following:

* **11111110-2222-3333-4444444**: Integration ID
* **coreCompany**: ServiceNow table
* **country**: Table column in **coreCompany**
* **japan**: Query search field

parameters.description: Case-insensitive search filter. Response includes only items that contain the query as a substring.
parameters.name: query

x-codeSamples.source:

  --url 'https://api.prismacloud.io/template/servicenow/{integrationId}/{incidentType}/fields/{objectName}/{referenceField}/suggestions?query=SOME_STRING_VALUE' \
  --header 'x-redlock-auth: REPLACE_KEY_VALUE'
